trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGME101_04932_SEQ_00<tab>Cahciua regards you with concerned curiosity.

TEXT_KINGME101_04932_SEQ_01<tab>Having given you an overview of the usage of souls in Alexandria, Cahciua bids you return to her group's hideout in Earthen Sky. But before you do so, Wuk Lamat wishes to have a discussion with your party, and so you gather by the tunnel entrance.

TEXT_KINGME101_04932_SEQ_02<tab>Wuk Lamat proposes cooperating with Oblivion, that you might obtain the intelligence you need to contend with the enemy. While Erenville is wary of doing so, saying that it may not be his mother behind the machine, the rest of your party is willing to take the risk. The decision thus made, you all make your way into the tunnel to join your prospective collaborators.

TEXT_KINGME101_04932_SEQ_03<tab>When Wuk Lamat pleads her case to Cahciua, it quickly transpires that the desire to work together is very much mutual. So it is that you join hands with Oblivion, and immediately begin making plans to draw Zoraal Ja out of hiding. Knowing his deep-seated yearning to surpass their father, Wuk Lamat suggests striking at him when he grows weary of waiting and instead moves to invade Tuliyollal again. Until that time, you must prepare for battle by learning about the technology that empowers your foe. To that end, Cahciua offers to show you to Oblivion's main headquarters inside Everkeep, but first you turn your attention to Geode, who wishes to introduce his crew.

TEXT_KINGME101_04932_SEQ_04<tab>In addition to Geode himself, you are introduced to the twins Nostalgia and Wayakkwe, who share their tragic motive for joining the fight against Zoraal Ja. It appears the Mamool Ja has done little to endear himself to the people of Alexandria since becoming their ruler...
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Wuk Lamat.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Cahciua at the Earthen Sky hideout.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Geode.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_ALISAIE_000_001<tab>Having seen the beauty of the aetherial sea firsthand, I simply can't accept what they've done here in Alexandria.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_KRILE_000_002<tab>I understand this is part of their culture, but it is no less disconcerting.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GRAHATIA_000_003<tab>When Emet-Selch spoke of surprising civilizations in other reflections, I wonder if he had Alexandria in mind.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_ERENVILLE_000_004<tab>Sphene looks to be of an age with Alisaie and Wuk Lamat, but now I wonder if these regulators have anything to do with that.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_005<tab>Regulators give Zoraal Ja a frightful advantage, and that's just one of the devices he's gotten his hands on...
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_006<tab>If we're to have a chance at defeating him, we have to learn all we can about the technology he has at his disposal.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_020<tab>I trust you've gained an insight into the use of souls in Alexandria?
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_021<tab>It's shocking, I know─I was overwhelmed myself at first. I expect you'll need some time to digest it all, but for now, let's head back to Earthen Sky.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_022<tab>At this rate...
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_023<tab>There's something I want to discuss with everyone. Let's take a moment before we head into the tunnel.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_ALISAIE_000_025<tab>I understand the argument that we should keep an open mind, if this practice is integral to their culture. But every fiber of my being rails against it...
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_KRILE_000_026<tab>What does Lamaty'i wish to discuss, I wonder...

TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GRAHATIA_000_027<tab>'Tis well that we could see firsthand how regulators are used. To draw upon even the souls of fiends... I shudder to imagine how powerful Zoraal Ja could become.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_ERENVILLE_000_028<tab>To think that everyone has lived here for thirty years. Long enough to become accustomed to the way of life...
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_030<tab>I'm sorry for delaying us, but I have some thoughts I need to share.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_031<tab>In both technology...and values...it's plain there's a wide gulf between Tuliyollal and Alexandria.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_032<tab>And while Zoraal Ja knows everything about us, we know hardly anything about what he's become.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GRAHATIA_000_033<tab>Indeed... We haven't even seen what lies within that enormous tower, Everkeep.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_034<tab>So here I'd like to make a proposal.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_035<tab>That is, we work with Cahciua and her people.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_036<tab>We need to learn as much as we can about the enemy. The quickest way would be to join hands with Oblivion.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_037<tab>We've only just met them, I know, and we shouldn't be too quick to trust. But the fact remains that they share our desire to stop Zoraal Ja.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GRAHATIA_000_038<tab>Sphene, too, claims to be at odds with the King of Resolve. May I ask why you would cooperate with Oblivion instead?
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_039<tab>It's simple, really. Their leader is Erenville's mother.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_040<tab>Meanwhile, whatever Sphene may feel, she's a ruler of this nation. There's a greater risk in working with her, and less reason to take her at her word.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GRAHATIA_000_041<tab>A fair point. And knowing Zoraal Ja, we must assume that his arrangement with Sphene was not made without some consideration.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_KRILE_000_042<tab>All I know is that it would be heartening to have allies in this strange realm.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_KRILE_000_043<tab>I think everyone would agree that any help we can get would be welcome.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_ERENVILLE_000_044<tab>Hold on. There's no guarantee that it's actually my mother behind the machine.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_ERENVILLE_000_045<tab>Without seeing her in the flesh, we can't rule out the possibility of a ploy.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_ERENVILLE_000_046<tab>If it turns out to be a trap, we endanger not only ourselves, but everyone in Tuliyollal.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_047<tab>As you say, we have no proof that it really is Cahciua.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_048<tab>But I make my proposal in full awareness of this.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_049<tab>Whether we're going to war or striving for peace, we need to learn as much as we can. Otherwise we can't hope to do anything meaningful.

TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_050<tab>As it stands, we know too little about this realm. We need to remedy that. We need to study the enemy, and when the time comes, strike down Zoraal Ja for good and all.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_051<tab>What's more...
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_052<tab>I trust <var 1A 02 /var>you<var 1A 01 /var>, Erenville. You've always had great instincts, honed from your time training under your mother.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_ERENVILLE_000_053<tab>What if I'm wrong? What if sentiment is clouding my judgment?
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_Q1_000_000<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_A1_000_001<tab>If it's a trap, then we'll deal with it when it's sprung.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_A1_000_002<tab>I trust you as well.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_ERENVILLE_000_055<tab><sigh> That's always the way of it with you...
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_ERENVILLE_000_056<tab>Fine. If you're set on this, then I'll say no more.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_057<tab>Then it's settled. Let's head inside and secure ourselves some new allies!
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_ALISAIE_100_057<tab>While I'm all for dealing with Zoraal Ja, we need to consider how our actions may affect ordinary Alexandrians. They're not the enemy, after all.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_KRILE_110_057<tab>I agree with Wuk Lamat. It's a gamble regardless of whether or not we choose to work with the people here, and more knowledge is better than less.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GRAHATIA_000_058<tab>The Vow of Resolve is possessed of conviction and flexibility both. If the tales are true, she learned much in the course of the rite of succession.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_ERENVILLE_100_058<tab>I'm unaccustomed to seeing her make decisions like a ruler. Better that than her former vacillating self, though.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_059<tab>With the resources at their disposal, I'm hopeful that Cahciua and her people will make great allies!
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_060<tab>Cahciua, there's something I need to tell you and your people.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_061<tab>We came here for no other reason than to strike down Zoraal Ja.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GEODE_000_062<tab>But...I thought he was your brother.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GEODE_000_063<tab>Do you really mean to kill your own kin?
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_064<tab>My kin invaded our nation and murdered our people. As Vow of Resolve, it falls to me to bring him to account.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_065<tab>I am prepared to do what I must, and I won't hesitate when the time comes.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_066<tab>Like us, you and yours oppose Zoraal Ja. In light of this, I propose that we work together to stop him once and for all.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_067<tab>I realize that this is sudden. That it's a gamble to trust someone you've only just met.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_068<tab>But I would trust in the conviction of anyone who shares my goal. So fight with me, I beg you!
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_069<tab>As you say, our goals align. And I don't doubt your resolve in the least.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_070<tab>If you hadn't proposed working together, I would've done so instead.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_071<tab>Truth be told, it's been tough going at it alone. While we've gathered ample intelligence, we don't have the strength to take decisive action.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_072<tab>Besides, how could we <var 1A 02 /var>not<var 1A 01 /var> trust you?
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_073<tab>My only son is with you─my fussy little bunbun. He's all the reason I need.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_074<tab>Then it's decided. Here's to a fruitful collaboration!
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_075<tab>Thank you, Cahciua, everyone! Together we'll achieve great things, I'm sure of it!
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_ALISAIE_000_076<tab>Then let's not waste any time. We've been wondering about Zoraal Ja's whereabouts. Is there a palace inside that tower?
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GEODE_000_077<tab>After a fashion. The king resides on the uppermost level. But while Queen Sphene has a penchant for going out in public, he seldom shows himself.

TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GEODE_000_078<tab>What's more, his movements are highly classified. Not even his commanders are privy to that information. If anyone knows where he is at any given time, it could only be the queen.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_079<tab>Even if we don't know his whereabouts, Zoraal Ja will eventually march on Tuliyollal again. That's when we can go after him.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_080<tab>The drawback is we'd have to wait for the invasion to happen. Innocents would be put in harm's way.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_081<tab>There's also the possibility that he'll leave everything to his minions and not command the army in person.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_082<tab>No. He'll take the field.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_083<tab>What makes you so certain?
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_084<tab>My brother has always yearned to surpass our father. That's why he attacked Tuliyollal.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_100_084<tab>After waiting for thirty years, the first thing he wanted to do was demonstrate his newfound strength.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_085<tab>But killing Papa didn't satisfy him. So now he's bent on proving himself stronger than me and Koana, who bested him in the rite of succession.

TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_086<tab>He challenged me to strike him down. He wants a duel to show everyone that he's superior to the Dawnservant, and he won't let his minions deprive him of the pleasure.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_ALISAIE_000_087<tab>Then why hasn't he appeared and given you your chance? Surely, he's aware of our presence here.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_088<tab>At that, I can only guess. Perhaps he wants to dazzle us with his wondrous realm. But if he won't deign to appear, then we'll force him to do so.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_089<tab>Even as we gather intelligence, we make no move to attack him. Show absolutely no interest in a confrontation.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_090<tab>Knowing him, he'll tire of waiting and turn his attention to Koana instead. He'll attack Tuliyollal again, like he said he would.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_091<tab>I see... If you believe this the best approach, then we have no objections.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_092<tab>Any campaign against Tuliyollal requires that Zoraal Ja lead his forces through Vanguard. We'll have lookouts keep an eye on it day and night.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_KRILE_000_093<tab>Such a strategy is certainly viable... If we're proceeding with it, though, we should warn those outside.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_ALISAIE_000_094<tab>Indeed. They'll need time to prepare their defenses.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GRAHATIA_000_095<tab>I should be glad to coordinate our efforts. I'm already in regular contact with Y'shtola, and will make sure to keep our comrades apprised of developments.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GEODE_000_096<tab>You can leave Vanguard to us. We'll send word at the first sign of movement.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_097<tab>It seems we have a plan.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_098<tab>While we wait for Zoraal Ja to move, you'd do well to prepare for battle, and it begins with familiarizing yourselves with the technology that empowers him.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_099<tab>To that end, I'll show you to Oblivion's main headquarters.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_100<tab>Oh? I thought this place was it.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_101<tab><chuckle> You'll be impressed to know that we're located right inside that tower, in the residential district of Solution Nine.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_102<tab>Hiding a tree in the forest, as it were.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_103<tab>The only question is how to get you through the checkpoint...
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_104<tab>Ah, about that. Sphene said that she'd make it so we could enter without issue.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_105<tab>She did? Curious. She's not supposed to have such authority over the sentries.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_KRILE_000_106<tab>If I recall correctly, her words were that she would register us as guests.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_000_107<tab>I see. Perhaps we're in the clear, then.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_CAHCIUA_100_107<tab>When you're ready, come and meet me at the tower entrance.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GEODE_000_108<tab>Before you head out, give us a moment to introduce ourselves properly, eh?
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GEODE_000_109<tab>After all, names are good to know when working together.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_ALISAIE_000_110<tab>Between making new friends and entering the tower, I can't help but feel a little excited.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_KRILE_000_111<tab>(Is it just me or are Erenville and Cahciua complete opposites in personality?)
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GRAHATIA_000_112<tab>The intelligence that Cahciua and her people possess will be very useful to our efforts.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_ERENVILLE_000_113<tab>...It's eerie hearing my mother's voice come from that peculiar machine.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_114<tab>If this isn't their main headquarters, I can't imagine what the actual place is like...
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_NOSTALGIA_000_115<tab>If Cahciua trusts you, then so do we!
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WAYAKKWE_000_116<tab>Um... N-Nice to meet you...
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GEODE_000_120<tab>While Oblivion has operatives all over, we're the main crew here.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GEODE_000_121<tab>I'm Geode, the leader of this hideout.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GEODE_000_122<tab>And the dependable young twins behind me are Nostalgia and Wayakkwe.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_NOSTALGIA_000_123<tab>I'm Nostalgia! It's a pleasure to meet you.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_NOSTALGIA_000_124<tab>My sister and I were born and raised inside the barrier.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_NOSTALGIA_000_125<tab>We've been with Oblivion for three years, and our main duties are surveillance and provisioning.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_126<tab>Twins, eh? That explains the resemblance. Wayakkwe is a Tonawawtan name, unless I'm mistaken?
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_NOSTALGIA_000_127<tab>That's right. Our mother is Tuliyollan and our father is Alexandrian. They wanted to honor both cultures.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_KRILE_000_128<tab>They're beautiful names.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WAYAKKWE_000_129<tab>Th-Thank you. Though I have no memories of my mother, I like to think I carry a part of her with me.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_130<tab>So, what made you decide to join Oblivion?
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_NOSTALGIA_000_131<tab>We wanted to avenge our father.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_NOSTALGIA_000_132<tab>Ambrose was his name, and years ago, he was taken away after a scuffle with a soldier over a disagreement.

TEXT_KINGME101_04932_NOSTALGIA_000_133<tab>It was a minor incident, so at first we clung to the hope that he'd be released. But when months went by with no word from or about him, we made the decision to remove our regulators.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_NOSTALGIA_000_134<tab>We had already lost the memories of our mother. We didn't want to lose those of our father as well.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_NOSTALGIA_000_135<tab>They've all forgotten about him now─everyone who had known him...
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_136<tab>That bastard... Even here, he thinks nothing of his own people!
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_NOSTALGIA_000_137<tab>Some time later, we were approached by a member of Oblivion. Hoping to get justice for our father, we joined the order.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_NOSTALGIA_000_138<tab>I'm sorry, I didn't mean to darken the mood...
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_139<tab>No, no, I appreciate you sharing this. Together, we'll avenge your father.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_NOSTALGIA_000_140<tab>Thank you. Something tells me you have what it takes.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_NOSTALGIA_000_141<tab>You introduce yourself too. Go on!
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WAYAKKWE_000_142<tab>Um... It's pretty much the same story for me.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WAYAKKWE_000_143<tab>And while mine is a Tonawawtan name, I haven't the faintest how things are outside the barrier.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WAYAKKWE_000_144<tab>It's my dream to go and see it with my own eyes. Our mother's homeland.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_WUKLAMAT_000_145<tab>Once peace is restored, you must come and visit. The wilds are beautiful, the food delicious, and everyone so nice. You'll love it!
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GEODE_000_146<tab>And that's us here. You'll meet others in the Backroom─that's our headquarters. Some of them are a little eccentric, but they have good hearts, all.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GEODE_000_147<tab>Ah, Elene'shpya. One last thing.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GEODE_000_148<tab>It isn't exactly my place to say this, but thank you for seeking out Cahciua. She talks about you so much, it's clear how important you are to her.
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_ERENVILLE_000_149<tab>...
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GEODE_000_150<tab>That's all. Be good to your mother while you still can, eh?
TEXT_KINGME101_04932_GEODE_000_151<tab>Well, we'll let you go now. Feel free to use this hideout as you like.
